data.title: Shaheed Udham Singh
data.meta_description: On 31 July 1940, Udham Singh was hanged at Pentonville Prison. Im pretty sure everyone knows about him and what he did for india. Thought I'd just share...
data.text:
RIP to Ram Mohammad Singh Azad, who avenged the Amritsar massacre.

I hope we can all remember the deeds of people like him, Bhagat Singh, Chandrashekar Azad and Lajpat Rai and what they really stood for. Today in India you will see their faces plastered on so many different things from Youth groups to random ass political parties. It is a shame that their deaths and sacrifices have been used for political gain. I have an example for you guys.

In the 70s there was a movement to bring back Udham Singh's ashes, Indira Gandhi and the Congress quickly latched on so they could be associated with it and when his ashes came back to India they went with it to his house in Sunam and eventually to Haridwar where his ashes were immersed in the Ganges. Why did they do this? So they could gain the sympathy of the Punjabi people because election was near.

My great uncles were a part of the delegation to bring back his ashes and immerse them and here is a copy of the document of what the pandey wrote in Haridwar, describing the journey of the ashes and where it has been. (Just a quick aside, in Haridwar there are pandits who keep genealogical records for different clans. Reason being is that in the old days each Hindu clan kept records and anytime anyone from the family would go to the pandits and update or add to the records like deaths, births marriages and stuff. Lot of Sikh families in India still follow the tradition, including people from Udham Singh's community)

I don't know if it is on the page but it should mention something about Indira Gandhi and Zail Singh about being there. Long story short my great uncles told me that the Congress party wanted to take the ashes on a nationwide tour to drum up support for the Congress Party, the delegation that brought his ashes back got pissed and said no.

Moral of the story: politicians are dicks. Remember what the martyrs stood for and don't let anyone use their images and twist their meaning.

Attachments

2.2 MB Views: 27

Dooood. That pic you posted is the exact type of book that my dad updated 2 summers ago. It's great to check out your family history and realize that they have been coming to the same place since the mid 1800's..
